greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n minus (product of nonzero digits in factorial base representation of n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5040
example: 22 has factorial expansion A007623(22) = "320", and multiplying the nonzero digits, we get 3*2 = 6, and 22-6 = 16, thus a(22)=16.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 04 2013
